TopicTitle: Craft momentarily moves away from its trajectory at high speed, before snapping back

Articles.Content:
Reported Version: v0.2.0 (latest) | Mods: none | Can replicate without mods? Yes 
OS: Windows 11 | CPU:  Intel Core i7-9700 | GPU: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2060 | RAM: 15.81

 

Craft suddenly disappears from view and then reappears on a much higher energy trajectory, usually out of the system.

I've found this a few times on launching from Kerbin with a variety of different craft.  Not sure if there is a pattern, but it occurs in the upper atmosphere, sometimes when fast forward has previously been used. Once set-in it reoccurs (even restarting the game doesnt help) and is now present in every launch.

Edited December 22, 2023 by The Space Peacock

Hey,

i also had this bug and it came at a very bad time for me ... i was just at the point to complete the "Under Pressure" mission ... but every time i left the atmosphere the vessel glitched out and exploded.

Process:

I created a new campaign, cheated my science back and rebuild the vessel fron scratch. IT WORKED. Nice.... I copied the new vessel workspace into my old campaign ... and the problem was back.  WHAT?
Okay ... don't give up! I tried to compare (via Notepad++) the latest old campaign savegame with the  error to the new campaign savegame in which everything was working. I found no noticeable difference.
Then i copied the new campaign savegame into my OLD campaign savegame folder, and the problem occurred again ... SUS!

Assumption:

It is the campaign savegame FOLDER! Mine had over 400 savegames and 80 workspaces.
In the moment the vessel leaves the atmosphere, the game creates an autosave file .... and at a too high file count, this seems to cause the problem.

Solution:

I deleted hundred of old savegame files and no longer needed workspace files.
Savegame Path: C:\Users\ [NAME] \AppData\LocalLow\Intercept Games\Kerbal Space Program 2\Saves\SinglePlayer\
The problem did not occur again since.

This also explains why only longer campaigns seem to be affected and trying to reproduce the bug with a single savegame was unsuccessful ;-)

I hope u can reproduce my solution for your campaign.

Side effect:

My whole game runs at a noticeable higher framerate than before the deletion of all the files  ..... what?

OS: Windows 10 | CPU: AMD Ryzen 7 5800X | GPU: GeForce GTX 1060 6GB | RAM: 16GB DDR4

When launching a ship it will always 'zoom off' out of frame whenever I exceed 70km. The orbit speed stays true to what it should be, but the altitude very quickly exceeds 1000km+. This usually carries on for about 1 minute or so before it seemingly coming back to normal. By this time, the ship will have been carrying on with it's original trajectory, but depending on how long the altitude is bugged out, that might mean I've missed my apoapsis.

I have noticed that if I throttle up slightly it doesn't seem to do the bug, but if I turn the throttle off relatively soon after 70km, it still does the same thing.

This has happened on multiple different ship designs, and I have verified game files in-between launches.

I am also affected by this bug.

I first encountered it on the Duna Monument mission: It took me several tries to land near the monument and when I launched again, each time I reached a certain altitude (I suppose when I left the atmosphere) my craft would disappear and the camera would move out, while the altitude readings increased (same as in the videos posted in this thread).

Eventually I used the debug menu to get to orbit and return to Kerbin. But when I tried to launch another craft from Kerbin, the same happened again: After I reached an altitude of a bit over 70 km, the craft disappeared, zoomed out to the end of Kerbins SOI, then snapped back, but was uncontrollably spinning and the parts were also not connected anymore.

After a few more attempts, I realized that this affected every craft and every save in that campaign. It also doesn't make any difference how I launch (normal gravity turn, straight up, going full throttle all the way or coasting past 70 km).

The campaign is not playable like this, because I cannot launch any craft and starting a new campaign doesn't make sense, if the bug could appear again.
